Namespace:

Parameters for filtering, sorting, faceting, paging, and other search query behaviors.

Properties

Count Count

Edit

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to fetch the total count of results. Default is false. Setting this value to true may have a performance impact. Note that the count returned is an approximation.

public bool ? Count { get; set; }Public Property Count As Boolean?
Value
Nullable<Boolean> Nullable(Of Boolean)

Facets Facets

Edit

Gets or sets the list of facet expressions to apply to the search query. Each facet expression contains a field name, optionally followed by a comma-separated list of name:value pairs.

public IList<string> Facets { get; set; }Public Property Facets As IList(Of String)
Value
IList<String> IList(Of String)

Filter Filter

Edit

Gets or sets the OData $filter expression to apply to the search query.

public string Filter { get; set; }Public Property Filter As String
Value
String String

Highlight Highlight

Edit

Gets or sets the comma-separated list of field names to use for hit highlights. Only searchable fields can be used for hit highlighting.

public string Highlight { get; set; }Public Property Highlight As String
Value
String String

HighlightPostTag HighlightPostTag

Edit

Gets or sets a string tag that is appended to hit highlights. Must be set with HighlightPreTag. Default is </em>.

public string HighlightPostTag { get; set; }Public Property HighlightPostTag As String
Value
String String

HighlightPreTag HighlightPreTag

Edit

Gets or sets a string tag that is prepended to hit highlights. Must be set with HighlightPostTag. Default is <em>.

public string HighlightPreTag { get; set; }Public Property HighlightPreTag As String
Value
String String

MinimumCoverage MinimumCoverage

Edit

Gets or sets a number between 0 and 100 indicating the percentage of the index that must be covered by a search query in order for the query to be reported as a success. This parameter can be useful for ensuring search availability even for services with only one replica. The default is 100.

public double ? MinimumCoverage { get; set; }Public Property MinimumCoverage As Double?
Value
Nullable<Double> Nullable(Of Double)

OrderBy OrderBy

Edit

Gets or sets the comma-separated list of OData $orderby expressions by which to sort the results. Each expression can be either a field name or a call to the geo.distance() function. Each expression can be followed by asc to indicate ascending, and desc to indicate descending. The default is ascending order. Ties will be broken by the match scores of documents. If no OrderBy is specified, the default sort order is descending by document match score. There can be at most 32 Orderby clauses.

public string OrderBy { get; set; }Public Property OrderBy As String
Value
String String

QueryType QueryType

Edit

Gets or sets gets or sets a value that specifies the syntax of the search query. The default is 'simple'. Use 'full' if your query uses the Lucene query syntax. Possible values include: 'simple', 'full'

public QueryType? QueryType { get; set; }Public Property QueryType As QueryType?
Value
Nullable<QueryType> Nullable(Of QueryType)

ScoringParameters ScoringParameters

Edit

Gets or sets the list of parameter values to be used in scoring functions (for example, referencePointParameter) using the format name:value. For example, if the scoring profile defines a function with a parameter called 'mylocation' the parameter string would be "mylocation:-122.2,44.8"(without the quotes).

public IList<string> ScoringParameters { get; set; }Public Property ScoringParameters As IList(Of String)
Value
IList<String> IList(Of String)

ScoringProfile ScoringProfile

Edit

Gets or sets the name of a scoring profile to evaluate match scores for matching documents in order to sort the results.

public string ScoringProfile { get; set; }Public Property ScoringProfile As String
Value
String String

Search Search

Edit

Gets or sets a full-text search query expression; Use null or "*" to match all documents.

public string Search { get; set; }Public Property Search As String
Value
String String

SearchFields SearchFields

Edit

Gets or sets the comma-separated list of field names to include in the full-text search.

public string SearchFields { get; set; }Public Property SearchFields As String
Value
String String

SearchMode SearchMode

Edit

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether any or all of the search terms must be matched in order to count the document as a match. Possible values include: 'any', 'all'

public SearchMode? SearchMode { get; set; }Public Property SearchMode As SearchMode?
Value
Nullable<SearchMode> Nullable(Of SearchMode)

Select Select

Edit

Gets or sets the comma-separated list of fields to retrieve. If unspecified, all fields marked as retrievable in the schema are included.

public string Select { get; set; }Public Property Select As String
Value
String String

Skip Skip

Edit

Gets or sets the number of search results to skip. This value cannot be greater than 100,000. If you need to scan documents in sequence, but cannot use Skip due to this limitation, consider using OrderBy on a totally-ordered key and Filter with a range query instead.

public int ? Skip { get; set; }Public Property Skip As Integer?
Value
Nullable<Int32> Nullable(Of Int32)

Top Top

Edit

Gets or sets the number of search results to retrieve. This can be used in conjunction with Skip to implement client-side paging of search results. If results are truncated due to server-side paging, the response will include a continuation token that can be passed to ContinueSearch to retrieve the next page of results. See DocumentSearchResponse.ContinuationToken for more information.

public int ? Top { get; set; }Public Property Top As Integer?
Value
Nullable<Int32> Nullable(Of Int32)
